title: Art Deco poster design... please help!
content: Doing up a brochure on Art Deco Poster Art for my design course... Am designing the brochure as a poster (it’s a 5 page concertina fold...)... would appreciate any suggestions for good typefaces to use... Thanks heaps!
author: mfrog

comments.content:
Take a look at DaFont.com and do a search for Art Deco. You should come up with some good things. Do it cleanly with nice rich, vibrant colors. See if you can’t get into Photoshop and get an illustrated look going. Also, I think city skylines and things of that nature were big back then so you might incorporate a skyline into your design somehow.

Hope that helps!

Tee-Hee! This reminds me of an Art Deco poster I did back in school. What fun!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20090926143213im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/artdeco_6081.jpg)

 [www.ivangdesign.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20090926143213/http:/www.ivangdesign.com/ "www.ivangdesign.com")

[Anna](http://web.archive.org/web/20090926143213/http:/www.linotype.com/229278/itcanna-family.html) — I thought of that, but considered it “too obvious”. Oprion, your poster makes me re-think — it’s great!
